content:
A commercially available cellulose source in India is microcrystalline cellulose (MCC). MCC is a purified, partially depolymerized cellulose derived from wood pulp or cotton linters. It is widely used in the pharmaceutical, food, and cosmetic industries as an excipient, binder, or thickening agent.

One prominent manufacturer of microcrystalline cellulose in India is:

Ankit Pulps & Boards Pvt. Ltd.
Address: 26, Nemichand Chambers, 3rd Floor, 8, Esplanade, Dhobi Talao, Mumbai – 400 001, Maharashtra, India
Phone: +91-22-2201 6667 / 2208 6626
Email: [info@ankitpulps.com](mailto:info@ankitpulps.com)
Website: <http://www.ankitpulps.com>

They offer various grades of microcrystalline cellulose suitable for different applications.

Remember to consult with material experts or scientists to determine the appropriate grade and quantity of MCC to use as a binder in your cactus-based vegan leather production process.
